Stock

Class Stock

  • java.lang.Object
    • Stock.Stock

  • public class Stock
extends java.lang.Object
    The 'Stock' class is used to manipulate collections of items, and is used for representing store inventory, stock orders, sales logs, and truck cargo.
    Author:
    Mary Millar

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Stock()
      A constructor that's used to seperate the different 'stocks' that exist.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Stock

        public Stock()
        A constructor that's used to seperate the different 'stocks' that exist.

    • Method Detail

      • clearStock

        public void clearStock()
        A method that empties out the contents of the current stock.

      • addItem

        public void addItem(Item item,
                    int quantity)
             throws StockException
        A method that adds an item to the current stock. This method takes into consideration if the item to be added already exists, and updates the quantity accordingly.
        Parameters:
        item - The item that is being added.
        quantity - The quantity of the item to be added.
        Throws:
        StockException - The exception thrown if attempting to add a negative amount of item to the store.

      • getItems

        public Item[] getItems()
        A method that retrieves an array of all the items in the current stock. This method takes into account that a stock may be empty.
        Returns:
        An array of type Item representing all of the items in the current stock.

      • addStock

        public void addStock(Stock stock)
              throws StockException
        A method that adds an 'outside' stock to the current stock.
        Parameters:
        stock - The stock to be added to the current stock.
        Throws:
        StockException - The exception inherited from addItem().

      • sumCosts

        public double sumCosts()
        A method that returns the sum of manufacturing costs of all the items currently in the stock.
        Returns:
        A double representing the total sum of the manufacturing costs in the current stock.

      • sumPrices

        public double sumPrices()
        A method that returns the sum of the sale prices of all the items currently in the stock.
        Returns:
        A double representing the total sum of the sale prices in the current stock.

      • getListCold

        public Item[] getListCold()
        A method that returns a sorted list of all the items in the current stock that must be temperature-controlled.
        Returns:
        An array of type 'Item' representing all the 'cold' items in the current stock.

      • getListOrdinary

        public Item[] getListOrdinary()
        A method that returns an unsorted list of all the non-temperature-controlled items in the current stock.
        Returns:
        An array of type 'Item' representing all the 'ordinary' items in the current stock.

      • getColdestTemp

        public java.lang.Double getColdestTemp()
        A method that retrieves the lowest temperature of any item in the current stock. This is used to ensure any items do not spoil in the supply chain proccess.
        Returns:
        A double representing the 'coldest' temperature-controlled item.

      • getManifestPrintStyle

        public java.lang.String getManifestPrintStyle()
        This method formats the information in the current stock into a 'manifest' style (ie. [item],[quantity]).
        Returns:
        A string representing a list that contains items in the current stock and their quantity.

      • getAmount

        public int getAmount(Item item)
        This method retrieves the quantity of the specified item in the current stock.
        Parameters:
        item - The name of the item.
        Returns:
        An integer representing the amount of an item that is being held in the current stock.

      • subtractItem

        public void subtractItem(Item item,
                         int subtractAmount)
                  throws StockException
        This method subtracts the specified item and quantity from the current stock.
        Parameters:
        item - The name of the item.
        subtractAmount - The quantity being subtracted.
        Throws:
        StockException - The exception thrown if either the item name or quantity is invalid.

      • getItemFromName

        public static Item getItemFromName(java.lang.String string)
                            throws StockException
        This method returns an item specified by its name.
        Parameters:
        string - The name of the item.
        Returns:
        the Item with the input name
        Throws:
        StockException - The exception thrown if the item is not found in the store.

      • addItemName

        public void addItemName(java.lang.String string,
                        int quantity)
                 throws StockException
        This method adds the quantity of an item (specified by its name) into the store.
        Parameters:
        string - The name of the item.
        quantity - The quantity being added.
        Throws:
        StockException - The exception thrown if the item is not found in the store.

      • subtractStock

        public void subtractStock(Stock stock)
                   throws StockException
        This method subtracts a whole 'outside' stock from the current stock.
        Parameters:
        stock - The 'outside' stock
        Throws:
        StockException - The exception thrown if there is not enough of an item to subtract.

      • sumAmount

        public int sumAmount()
        This method retrieves the total amount of items (ie. all their quantities) in the current stock.
        Returns:
        An integer representing the total amount of items in the current stock.

      • needsReorder

        public Item[] needsReorder()
        This method retrieves a list of all the items that need to be reordered.
        Returns:
        An array of type 'Item' that represents all the items to be reordered.

      • validSubtractItem

        public boolean validSubtractItem(Item item,
                                 int quantity)
                          throws StockException
        This method determines if the removal of an item from a stock will be successful or not.
        Parameters:
        item - The name of the item.
        quantity - The quantity to be removed.
        Returns:
        A boolean representing if the removal of an item from a stock will be successful (true) or not (false).
        Throws:
        StockException - The exception thrown if there was not enough of an item to be subtracted, or if the store did not contain the item.

      • validSubtractStock

        public boolean validSubtractStock(Stock stock)
                           throws StockException
        This method determines if the removal of an 'outside' stock from the current stock will be successful or not.
        Parameters:
        stock - The name of the 'outside' stock.
        Returns:
        A boolean representing if the removal of the 'outside' stock will be successful (true) or not (false).
        Throws:
        StockException - The exception thrown if there was not enough of an item to be subtracted, or if the store did not contain the item.
